description: Borrowed from Italian falsetto, from falso (“false”).

entries.meaning: (singing, uncountable) The "false" (singing) voice in any human, usually airy and lacking a purity of vowels; created by utilizing the next highest vocal folds above those used for speech and normal range singing. It is commonly confused with the head voice register.
(music, countable) A person who sings in falsetto.

verbs.description: falsetto (third-person singular simple present falsettos, present participle falsettoing, simple past and past participle falsettoed)

entries.meaning: To sing or utter in falsetto.
